newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Hong Kong told not to follow Singapore example.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong told not to follow Singapore example.

text.p: Singapore is not a good political model for Hong Kong to follow after its handover to China, the opposition Singapore Democratic Party (SDP) says.

In a statement sent to media, SDP Secretary-General Chee Soon Juan said it was "important for Hong Kongers to remember that Singapore is not a good political model to follow. While Singapore has progressed economically, its political development remains decidedly primitive."
He described the midnight June 30 handover to China as an occasion for rejoicing.
But he warned that the celebration must "be accompanied with the long-term view of maintaining political stability which Hong Kong has enjoyed for so many years."
"Hong Kong has thrived because its people have enjoyed the freedoms which are so essential for today's modern society," Chee said.
"Singaporeans fear, more than respect, the PAP (People's Action Party) government," he said.
Singapore "is beginning to encounter problems of the backlash of years of stifling over-control by an authoritarian government," he added.
The SDP held three of the four opposition seats in parliament before the last general election in January, but has none in the current parliament.
Other opposition parties hold three seats and the PAP has 81.
